privacy_p1: Your privacy is paramount. This application is designed to run entirely locally in your browser.
privacy_p2: Data Storage: All the information you enter (schedules, classes, student names, annotations, etc.) is saved exclusively in your web browser's local storage (LocalStorage), on your own computer. No data is sent to any external server.
privacy_p3: Backups: When you use the "Save" feature, a .json file is generated and downloaded to your computer. This file contains all your data, and you are solely responsible for its safekeeping. When using "Open", the data from that file will replace the data currently stored in the browser.
privacy_p4: Data of Minors: The application may contain data of minors (names and annotations). It is your responsibility as a user to comply with the data protection regulations in force in your country or region regarding the management of this information.
privacy_p5: In short: your data is yours, it stays on your device, and it never leaves unless you decide to export it.
manual_welcome: Welcome to the Class Journal. This guide will help you set up and use all the features of the application.
manual_getting_started_p1: To start using the application, the first step is to set up your classes, schedules, and students. All of this is managed from the Settings tab.
manual_getting_started_li1: Define Course Dates: Set the start and end dates for the academic year. This helps the schedule display classes only within that period.
manual_getting_started_li2: Create Time Slots: Add the time slots for your day (e.g., "08:00-09:00", "09:00-10:00"). You can use the automatic generator to create them quickly.
manual_getting_started_li3: Create Your Activities/Classes: Add the subjects or groups you teach. Check the "Class with students" option if you want to assign students to it. "General activities" are for meetings, duties, etc.
manual_getting_started_li4: Set Up Your Base Schedule: Use the weekly schedule table to assign each activity to its corresponding day and time slot.
manual_getting_started_li5: Add Your Students: Go to the Classes tab or the "Activities Management" section in Settings to add students to each class. You can do it one by one or use the "Quick Import" tool.
manual_settings_activities_li1: Create: Enter a name, choose a type (class or general), and click "Add". A color will be assigned automatically, but you can change it by clicking on the color circle.
manual_settings_activities_li2: Edit: Click on an activity's name to edit it. You can change its name and the specific start/end dates for that class.
manual_settings_activities_li3: Assign Students: Within a "class" type activity, you can see the list of students and add new ones from the list of existing students.
manual_settings_generator_p1: This tool allows you to create time slots in bulk. Simply define the start and end times of the day, the duration of classes, and breaks.
manual_settings_overrides_p1: If a class is replaced by another for a period of time (e.g., for a special project or a field trip), you can create an override. This will take precedence over the base schedule for the dates you specify.
manual_schedule_usage_p1: The Schedule view is your daily hub.
manual_schedule_usage_li1: Navigation: Use the arrows to move between weeks and the "Today" button to return to the current week.
manual_schedule_usage_li2: View a Session: Click on any class block in the schedule to open the detail view for that session.
manual_schedule_usage_li3: Session Logging: In the detail view, you can:
manual_schedule_usage_li3_1: Jot down the plan for that class.
manual_schedule_usage_li3_2: Write a summary of what was actually done.
manual_schedule_usage_li3_3: Add individual notes for each student (questions, behavior, etc.).
manual_schedule_usage_li4: Navigate between sessions: Within a class's detail view, you can use the "Previous session" and "Next session" buttons to move chronologically through all classes for that same activity.
manual_schedule_usage_li5: Print: You can print a simplified version of the weekly schedule.
manual_students_classes_tab_p1: Here you can see all your classes and the list of students in each one. It's a good place to quickly add or remove students from a class.
manual_students_file_li1: To access the file, click on a student's name from the Classes view or from a session's detail view.
manual_students_file_li2_2: See which classes they are enrolled in.
manual_students_file_li2_3: Add general notes about the student that are not specific to a particular session.
manual_students_file_li2_4: View and edit the complete history of notes for that student across all sessions.
manual_students_file_li2_5: Print a complete file with all their information.
manual_students_import_p1: In Settings, you can use the import tool to add many students at once. Simply select the destination class and paste the list of names (one per line) into the text area.
manual_data_p1: All information is saved locally in your browser. This means the data is private and only accessible from the device and browser where you created it.
manual_data_backup_p1: The buttons to manage your data are now located in the main Schedule view, in the upper right corner.
manual_data_backup_li1_new: Save: Click this button to download a .json file with all your data (schedule, classes, students, notes, etc.). Save this file in a safe place as a backup.
manual_data_backup_li2_new: Open: If you switch computers or want to restore a backup, use this button and select the .json file you saved. Warning! This will replace all current data in the application.
manual_data_delete_p1_new: In the "Danger Zone" on the Settings page, you can permanently delete all application data. This action cannot be undone, so use it with caution.
